FuncDef: This command defines the 16 least significant bits (lsb) which, when combined with the 32 most significant bits of the PBBsource-bmac, are used as the virtual backbone MAC associated with this SDP. The virtual backbone MAC is used as the source backbone MAC for traffic received on a PBB EPIPE spoke-SDP withuse-sdp-bmacconfigured (that is, a redundant pseudowire) and forwarded into the B-VPLS domain.

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the 16 least significant bits of the virtual backbone MAC associated with this SDP. Values-1 to 65535 or xx-xx or xx:xx.
Specifies the VC identifier of the control pseudowire. Values-1 to 4294967295.
